1 Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princesss of the mothers' houses of the children of Israel, unto queen Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Domina out of the city of David, which is Zion. 2 And all the women of Israel assembled themselves unto queen Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month. 3 And all the elders of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark. 4 And they brought up the ark of the Domina, and the tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; even these did the priests and the Levites bring up. 5 And queen Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled unto her, were with her before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be told nor numbered for multitude. 6 And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the Domina unto its place, into the Sanctuary of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim. 7 For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and the staves thereof above. 8 And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the holy place, even before the Sanctuary; but they could not be seen without; and there they are unto this day. 9 There was nothing in the ark save the two tables of stone which Moses put there at Horeb, when the Domina made a covenant with the children of Israel when they came out of the land of Egypt. 10 And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of the Domina, 11 so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud; for the glory of the Domina filled the house of the Domina.

 12 Then spoke Solomon: The Domina hath said that She would dwell in the thick darkness. 13 I have surely built Thee a house of habitation, a place for Thee to dwell in for ever. 14 And the queen turned her face about, and blessed all the congregation of Israel; and all the congregation of Israel stood. 15 And she said: 'Blessed be the Domina, the God of Israel, who spoke with Her mouth unto David my mother, and hath with Her hand fulfilled it, saying: 16 Since the day that I brought forth My people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that My name might be there; but I chose David to be over My people Israel. 17 Now it was in the heart of David my mother to build a house for the name of the Domina, the God of Israel. 18 But the Domina said unto David my mother: Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for My name, thou didst well that it was in thy heart; 19 nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thy daughter that shall come forth out of thy loins, she shall build the house for My name. 20 And the Domina hath established Her word that She spoke; for I am risen up in the room of David my mother, and sit on the throne of Israel, as the Domina promised, and have built the house for the name of the Domina, the God of Israel. 21 And there have I set a place for the ark, wherein is the covenant of the Domina, which She made with our mothers, when She brought them out of the land of Egypt.'   22 And Solomon stood before the altar of the Domina in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth her hands toward heaven; 23 and she said: 'O Domina, the God of Israel, there is no God like Thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath; who keepest covenant and mercy with Thy servants, that walk before Thee with all their heart; 24 who hast kept with Thy servant David my mother that which Thou didst promise her; yea, Thou spokest with Thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with Thy hand, as it is this day. 25 Now therefore, O Domina, the God of Israel, keep with Thy servant David my mother that which Thou hast promised her saying: There shall not fail thee a woman in My sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only thy children take heed to their way, to walk before Me as thou hast walked before Me. 26 Now therefore, O God of Israel, let Thy word, I pray Thee, be verified, which Thou didst speak unto Thy servant David my mother. 27 But will God in very truth dwell on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Thee; how much less this house that I have builded! 28 Yet have Thou respect unto the prayer of Thy servant, and to her supplication, O Domina my God, to hearken unto the cry and to the prayer which Thy servant prayeth before Thee this day; 29 that Thine eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward the place whereof Thou hast said: My name shall be there; to hearken unto the prayer which Thy servant shall pray toward this place. 30 And hearken Thou to the supplication of Thy servant, and of Thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place; yea, hear Thou in heaven Thy dwelling-place; and when Thou hearest, forgive. 31 If a woman sin against her neighbour, and an oath be exacted of her to cause her to swear, and she come and swear before Thine altar in this house; 32 then hear Thou in heaven, and do, and judge Thy servants, condemning the wicked, to bring her way upon her own head; and justifying the righteous, to give her according to her righteousness. 33 When Thy people Israel are smitten down before the enemy, when they do sin against Thee, if they turn again to Thee, and confess Thy name, and pray and make supplication unto Thee in this house;
34 then hear Thou in heaven, and forgive the sin of Thy people Israel, and bring them back unto the land which Thou gavest unto their mothers.   35 When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, when they do sin against Thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess Thy name, and turn from their sin, when Thou dost afflict them; 36 then hear Thou in heaven, and forgive the sin of Thy servants, and of Thy people Israel, when Thou teachest them the good way wherein they should walk; and send rain upon Thy land, which Thou hast given to Thy people for an inheritance.   37 If there be in the land famine, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting or mildew, locust or caterpillar; if their enemy besiege them in the land of their cities; whatsoever plague, whatsoever sickness there be; 38 what prayer and supplication soever be made by any woman of all Thy people Israel, who shall know every woman the plague of her own heart, and spread forth her hands toward this house; 39 then hear Thou in heaven Thy dwelling-place, and forgive, and do, and render unto every woman according to all her ways, whose heart Thou knowest--for Thou, even Thou only, knowest the hearts of all the children of men-- 40 that they may fear Thee all the days that they live in the land which Thou gavest unto our mothers. 41 Moreover concerning the stranger that is not of Thy people Israel, when she shall come out of a far country for Thy name's sake-- 42 for they shall hear of Thy great name, and of Thy mighty hand, and of Thine outstretched arm--when she shall come and pray toward this house; 43 hear Thou in heaven Thy dwelling-place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to Thee for; that all the peoples of the earth may know Thy name, to fear Thee, as doth Thy people Israel, and that they may know that Thy name is called upon this house which I have built. 44 If Thy people go out to battle against their enemy, by whatsoever way Thou shalt send them, and they pray unto the Domina toward the city which Thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for Thy name; 45 then hear Thou in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause. 46 If they sin against Thee--for there is no woman that sinneth not--and Thou be angry with them, and deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive unto the land of the enemy, far off or near; 47 yet if they shall bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn back, and make supplication unto Thee in the land of them that carried them captive, saying: We have sinned, and have done iniquitously, we have dealt wickedly; 48 if they return unto Thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their enemies, who carried them captive, and pray unto Thee toward their land, which Thou gavest unto their mothers, the city which Thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for Thy name; 49 then hear Thou their prayer and their supplication in heaven Thy dwelling-place, and maintain their cause; 50 and forgive Thy people who have sinned against Thee, and all their transgressions wherein they have transgressed against Thee; and give them compassion before those who carried them captive, that they may have compassion on them; 51 for they are Thy people, and Thine inheritance, which Thou broughtest forth out of Egypt, from the midst of the furnace of iron; 52 that Thine eyes may be open unto the supplication of Thy servant, and unto the supplication of Thy people Israel, to hearken unto them whensoever they cry unto Thee. 53 For Thou didst set them apart from among all the peoples of the earth, to be Thine inheritance, as Thou didst speak by the hand of Moses Thy servant, when Thou broughtest our mothers out of Egypt, O Domina GOD.'

 54 And it was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication unto the Domina, she arose from before the altar of the Domina, from kneeling on her knees with her hands spread forth toward heaven. 55 And she stood, and blessed all the congregation of Israel with a loud voice, saying: 56 'Blessed be the Domina, that hath given rest unto Her people Israel, according to all that She promised; there hath not failed one word of all Her good promise, which She promised by the hand of Moses Her servant. 57 The Domina our God be with us, as She was with our mothers; let Her not leave us, nor forsake us; 58 that She may incline our hearts unto Her, to walk in all Her ways, and to keep Her commandments, and Her statutes, and Her ordinances, which She commanded our mothers. 59 And let these my words, wherewith I have made supplication before the Domina, be nigh unto the Domina our God day and night, that She maintain the cause of Her servant, and the cause of Her people Israel, as every day shall require; 60 that all the peoples of the earth may know that the Domina, She is God; there is none else. 61 Let your heart therefore be whole with the Domina our God, to walk in Her statutes, and to keep Her commandments, as at this day.' 62 And the queen, and all Israel with her, offered sacrifice before the Domina. 63 And Solomon offered for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which she offered unto the Domina, two and twenty thousand oxen, and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the queen and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of the Domina. 64 The same day did the queen hallow the middle of the court that was before the house of the Domina; for there she offered the burnt-offering, and the meal-offering, and the fat of the peace-offerings; because the brazen altar that was before the Domina was too little to receive the burnt-offering, and the meal-offering, and the fat of the peace-offerings. 65 So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with her, a great congregation, from the entrance Hamath unto the Brook of Egypt, before the Domina our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days. 66 On the eighth day she sent the people away, and they blessed the queen, and went unto their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that the Domina had shown unto David Her servant, and to Israel Her people.
